fields.name: id
fields.title: ID
fields.description: The identifier of the item.

fields.name: acceptedOffer
fields.title: Accepted Offer
fields.description: The offer e.g. product included in the order.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.title: Billing Address
fields.description: The billing address for the order.

fields.name: customer
fields.title: Customer
fields.description: Party placing the order.

fields.name: discount
fields.title: Discount
fields.description: Any discount applied (to an Order).

fields.name: discountCode
fields.title: Discount Code
fields.description: Code used to redeem a discount.

fields.name: discountCurrency
fields.title: Discount Currency
fields.description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the discount.

fields.name: isGift
fields.title: Is Gift
fields.description: Was the offer accepted as a gift for someone other than the buyer.

fields.name: merchant
fields.title: Merchant
fields.description: The party taking the order (e.g. Amazon.com is a merchant for many sellers).

fields.name: orderDate
fields.title: Order Date
fields.description: Date order was placed.

fields.name: orderedItem
fields.title: Ordered Item
fields.description: The item ordered.

fields.name: orderNumber
fields.title: Order Number
fields.description: The identifier of the transaction.

fields.name: orderStatus
fields.title: Order Status
fields.description: The current status of the order.

fields.name: paymentDue
fields.title: Payment Due
fields.description: The date that payment is due.

fields.name: paymentMethod
fields.title: Payment Method
fields.description: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

fields.name: paymentUrl
fields.title: Payment Url
fields.description: The URL for sending a payment.

fields.name: additionalType
fields.title: Additional Type
fields.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: A short description of the item.

fields.name: dateCreated
fields.title: Date Created
fields.description: The date on which this item was created.

fields.name: dateModified
fields.title: Date Modified
fields.description: The date on which this item was most recently modified.

fields.name: createdBy
fields.title: Created By
fields.description: Created by user.

fields.name: modifiedBy
fields.title: Modified By
fields.description: Modified by user.
